summary: This document is a series of forwarded emails between a U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutor and an FBI agent, coordinating the late-night submission and revision of a search warrant application for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence to Judge Moses. The emails detail specific revisions to the affidavit and the items to be seized, including a taxidermied dog, massage tables, and evidence related to victims.

persons.name: Judge Moses
persons.context: The judge being contacted to approve the search warrant application for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. The prosecutor coordinates the submission and swearing-in of the affiant agent via Facetime.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'EPSTEIN', the owner of the 'Subject Premises' (New York residence) to be searched. The affidavit describes observations in his office.

connections.description: Judge Moses is being asked to authorize a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence.

events.title: Late-Night Search Warrant Application Submission
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and an FBI agent prepare and submit a search warrant application for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence to Judge Moses, making revisions to the affidavit and items list.

keyFacts: The search warrant application targeted Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, specifically noting observations in his office.
Items to be seized included a taxidermied dog, massage tables and paraphernalia, busts of female torsos, nude photos in a 'Massage Room', sex toys, and a binder labeled 'PB Girls'.
The warrant application process occurred very late at night (July 6-7, 2019), indicating urgency.
The affiant FBI agent was to be sworn in by Judge Moses via Facetime before signing the documents.
